DOC.brief_summary: This study design investigate absorption , distribution , metabolism elimination single oral dose radiolabeled [ 14C ] -labeled RO5285119 healthy male participant .
DOC.brief_title: A Single-center Study Investigate How Quickly What Extent Radioactive Dose RO5285119 Absorbed , Metabolized Eliminated From Body Healthy Male Volunteers
DOC.criteria: Healthy male participant , 35 64 year age , inclusive For men female partner childbearing potential : Agreement use two method contraception , include one barrier method e.g . condom , treatment period least 3 month last dose study drug Participants intend donate sperm least 3 month last dose study drug History clinically significant gastrointestinal , renal , hepatic , bronchopulmonary , neurological , psychiatric , cardiovascular , endocrinological , hematological allergic disease , metabolic disorder , cancer cirrhosis Any personal familial history seizure , epilepsy convulsive condition , previous significant head trauma , factor predispose seizure Any major illness within one month screen examination febrile illness within one week prior screen first dose administration Concomitant disease condition could interfere , treatment might interfere , conduct study , would , opinion investigator , pose unacceptable risk subject History presence clinically relevant ECG abnormality , cardiovascular cerebrovascular disease History myopathy muscle disorder History evidence medical condition potentially alter absorption , metabolism elimination drug Any CYP3A inhibitor within 2 week within 5 time elimination halflife , whichever longer , prior dose Any CYP3A inducer within 4 week within 5 time elimination halflife , whichever longer , prior dose Infrequent bowel movement ( less per 24 hour average ) Regular work ionize radiation radioactive material
